text: A wise child \add hears\add* the discipline of a father,
but a scoffer does not listen to a rebuke.
From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he shall eat what is good,
but the desire\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Or “soul” \f* of the treacherous, wrongdoing.
He who keeps his mouth guards his life;\f + \fr 13:3 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
he who opens his lips, ruin \add belongs\add* to him.
The soul\f + \fr 13:4 \ft Or “life” \f* of the lazy craves, but there is nothing,
but the person of diligence is richly supplied.
The righteous hates a word of falsehood;
the wicked will bring shame and ⸤disgrace⸥.\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Literally “he will bring disgrace” \f*
Righteousness will guard the upright of way,
but wickedness will overthrow sin.
There is one who acts rich but ⸤has nothing⸥;\f + \fr 13:7 \ft Literally “there is no” \f*
another who pretends to be poor but \add has\add* wealth.
The ransom of the life of a man \add is\add* his wealth,
but the poor does not receive a threat.
The light of the righteous will rejoice,
but the lamp of the wicked will die out.
Only by insolence is strife set up,
and wisdom \add is\add* with those who take advice.
Wealth \add gained\add* from haste\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Or “vanity” \f* will dwindle,
but he who gathers ⸤little by little⸥\f + \fr 13:11 \ft Literally “upon the hand” \f* will increase it.
Hope that is deferred makes the heart\f + \fr 13:12 \ft Or “mind” \f* sick,
but a desire fulfilled \add is\add* a tree of life.
He who despises a word will bring destruction on himself,
but he who respects a commandment will be rewarded.
The teaching of the wise \add is\add* a fountain of life,
\add in order\add* to avoid the snares of death.
Good sense grants favor,
but the way of the faithless is coarse.
Anyone who is clever will act with intelligence,
but the fool will display folly.
A messenger of wickedness will fall into trouble,
but an envoy of the faithful \add brings\add* healing.
Poverty and disgrace \add belong to\add* him who ignores instruction,
but he who guards reproof will be honored.
A desire ⸤fulfilled⸥\f + \fr 13:19 \ft Literally “made to be,” “brought about” \f* will be sweet to the soul,
but an abomination of fools is turning from evil.
Walk with the wise and be wise,
but as for the companion of fools, he will suffer harm.
Misfortune will pursue sinners,
but the righteous ⸤will be rewarded with prosperity⸥.\f + \fr 13:21 \ft Literally “it will reward prosperity” \f*
He who is good will leave an inheritance to ⸤his grandchildren⸥,\f + \fr 13:22 \ft Literally “sons of sons” \f*
and stored up for the righteous \add is\add* the wealth of a sinner.
\add There is\add* much food \add in\add* the field of the poor,
but ⸤it is swept away⸥\f + \fr 13:23 \ft Literally “there is sweeping away” \f* by ⸤injustice⸥.\f + \fr 13:23 \ft Literally “no justice” \f*
He who withholds his rod hates his child,
but he who loves him ⸤gives him⸥\f + \fr 13:24 \ft Literally “visits him” \f* discipline.
The righteous eats to satisfy his life,\f + \fr 13:25 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
but the belly of the wicked will lack.
